articles.title: Les détecteurs de métaux ne trouvent pas bien les couteaux
articles.english_title: Security Metal Detectors Fail to Detect Knives
articles.simplified_french_title: Les détecteurs de métaux ne trouvent pas bien les couteaux
articles.simplified_english_title: Security Metal Detectors Fail to Detect Knives
articles.summary: Des tests récents montrent que les portiques de sécurité sont inefficaces pour détecter les couteaux, avec un taux d'échec très élevé.
articles.english_summary: Recent testing reveals that security gates are largely ineffective at detecting knives, with a very high failure rate.
articles.french_summary: Des tests récents montrent que les portiques de sécurité sont inefficaces pour détecter les couteaux, avec un taux d'échec très élevé.
articles.original_article_title: Agressions au couteau : "Les tests sur les portiques de sécurité montrent un échec de 80 % !"

Agressions.explanation: Physical attacks or violent acts committed against people. The plural form indicates multiple incidents.
Agressions.cultural_note: Recent knife attacks in France have heightened security concerns, particularly in public spaces.

au.explanation: A preposition combined with the definite article, indicating the method or means of attack

couteau.explanation: A sharp blade used as a tool or weapon
couteau.cultural_note: Knife-related violence has become a significant concern in French public safety discussions.

Les.explanation: Used before plural nouns to indicate specific items being discussed

tests.explanation: Formal examinations or trials to determine effectiveness or performance

sur.explanation: Indicates the subject or target of the testing

les.explanation: Used before plural nouns to indicate specific items

portiques de sécurité.display_format: **Security Gates/Metal Detectors:** Walk-through security screening devices
portiques de sécurité.explanation: Electronic devices used to detect metal objects on people passing through them
portiques de sécurité.cultural_note: Increasingly common in French public spaces, schools, and government buildings following security incidents.

échec.explanation: The state of not succeeding or meeting expected standards

de 80 %.explanation: Indicates the rate or proportion of failure

!.explanation: Punctuation mark indicating emphasis or alarm

articles.title: Internet ne fonctionne plus à Gaza après une attaque
articles.english_title: Internet Down in Gaza After Attack
articles.simplified_french_title: Internet ne fonctionne plus à Gaza après une attaque
articles.simplified_english_title: Internet Down in Gaza After Attack
articles.summary: L'accès à internet à Gaza a été interrompu suite à des dommages sur les câbles de fibre optique. La communication est maintenant limitée.
articles.english_summary: Internet access in Gaza has been disrupted after damage to fiber optic cables. Communication in the region is now limited.
articles.french_summary: L'accès à internet à Gaza a été interrompu suite à des dommages sur les câbles de fibre optique. La communication est maintenant limitée.
articles.original_article_title: Gaza : le réseau internet coupé après une attaque sur une ligne de fibre optique

Gaza.explanation: A Palestinian territory located on the eastern coast of the Mediterranean Sea
Gaza.cultural_note: Currently a major conflict zone between Israel and Hamas, with significant humanitarian concerns

réseau.explanation: A system of interconnected components, in this case referring to telecommunications infrastructure

internet.explanation: The worldwide computer network providing various information and communication facilities
internet.cultural_note: In French, 'internet' is typically written without a capital letter, unlike in English

coupé.explanation: To be disconnected or interrupted, from the verb 'couper' (to cut)

attaque.explanation: A deliberate act of aggression or violence against something

sur.explanation: Indicates location or target of an action

une ligne.explanation: A physical connection or route for transmission

de.explanation: Used to show possession or composition

fibre optique.explanation: Thin flexible fibers that transmit data as pulses of light
fibre optique.cultural_note: Critical infrastructure for modern internet communications

articles.title: Un avion Boeing d'Air India s'est écrasé
articles.english_title: Air India Boeing Plane Crash: What We Know
articles.simplified_french_title: Un avion Boeing d'Air India s'est écrasé
articles.simplified_english_title: Air India Boeing Plane Crash: What We Know
articles.summary: Un Boeing d'Air India s'est écrasé, causant une catastrophe aérienne majeure. Les autorités enquêtent sur les causes de l'accident.
articles.english_summary: An Air India Boeing aircraft has crashed, resulting in a major aviation disaster. Authorities are investigating the cause of the accident.
articles.french_summary: Un Boeing d'Air India s'est écrasé, causant une catastrophe aérienne majeure. Les autorités enquêtent sur les causes de l'accident.
articles.original_article_title: Crash du Boeing d'Air India : ce que l'on sait sur la catastrophe aérienne

Crash.explanation: An English loanword commonly used in French to describe aircraft accidents. The French equivalent would be 'écrasement' or 'accident'.
Crash.cultural_note: The use of English words in French media headlines is common, especially in technology and aviation contexts.

du.explanation: A contracted form combining the preposition 'de' (of) and the definite article 'le' (the)

Boeing.explanation: American aerospace company that manufactures commercial aircraft
Boeing.cultural_note: Boeing is one of the world's largest aircraft manufacturers and its name is often used generically to refer to its aircraft.

d'.explanation: Preposition indicating possession or belonging, contracted before a vowel sound

Air India.explanation: The flag carrier airline of India
Air India.cultural_note: National airlines often represent their countries in international aviation and are significant symbols of national identity.

ce que.explanation: A relative pronoun construction used to introduce indirect questions or statements

l'.explanation: Definite article that contracts before vowel sounds

on.explanation: Indefinite pronoun commonly used in French to express general statements or replace 'nous' (we) in informal contexts
on.cultural_note: 'On' is very frequently used in French news headlines and everyday speech, more so than its English equivalents.

sait.explanation: Third person singular present tense of the verb 'savoir' (to know)

sur.explanation: Preposition indicating the topic or subject being discussed

catastrophe aérienne.explanation: A serious accident involving aircraft, typically resulting in significant damage or loss of life
catastrophe aérienne.cultural_note: The term 'catastrophe' is commonly used in French media for major disasters and carries more neutral connotations than its English cognate.

articles.title: Les entreprises françaises sont leaders en informatique quantique
articles.english_title: French Companies Lead in Quantum Computing
articles.simplified_french_title: Les entreprises françaises sont leaders en informatique quantique
articles.simplified_english_title: French Companies Lead in Quantum Computing
articles.summary: Les start-up françaises développent des technologies avancées dans le domaine de l'informatique quantique, plaçant la France parmi les leaders mondiaux.
articles.english_summary: French startups are developing advanced quantum computing technologies, positioning France among global leaders in this innovative field.
articles.french_summary: Les start-up françaises développent des technologies avancées dans le domaine de l'informatique quantique, plaçant la France parmi les leaders mondiaux.
articles.original_article_title: Ordinateur quantique : pourquoi les start-up tricolores sont à l’avant-garde

Ordinateur.explanation: A machine that processes information and performs calculations

quantique.explanation: Refers to the branch of physics dealing with atomic and subatomic particles, here applied to computing
quantique.cultural_note: France has historically been strong in mathematics and physics research, contributing to quantum theory development

:.explanation: Used to introduce an explanation or list

pourquoi.explanation: Used to ask for reasons or explanations

les.explanation: Used before plural nouns to indicate specific items

start-up.explanation: A newly established company, typically focused on innovation and technology
start-up.cultural_note: French has adopted this English term, though 'jeune pousse' exists as a French alternative

tricolores.explanation: Refers to French entities, derived from the three colors of the French flag
tricolores.cultural_note: The term 'tricolore' is commonly used to refer to anything French, especially in sports and business contexts

sont.explanation: Third person plural of the verb 'être' (to be)

à.explanation: Used to indicate location or state

l'.explanation: Used before words beginning with vowels or silent h

avant-garde.explanation: Refers to being at the leading edge or most advanced position in a field
avant-garde.cultural_note: Term originally from military context, now commonly used in art and technology to indicate innovation leadership

articles.title: Vietnam: réduction importante des employés de l'État
articles.english_title: Vietnam: Major Cuts in Government Employment
articles.simplified_french_title: Vietnam: réduction importante des employés de l'État
articles.simplified_english_title: Vietnam: Major Cuts in Government Employment
articles.summary: Le Vietnam réduit fortement le nombre d'employés dans son administration publique pour faire face aux défis économiques actuels.
articles.english_summary: Vietnam is significantly reducing its public sector workforce to address current economic challenges and prepare for trade pressures.
articles.french_summary: Le Vietnam réduit fortement le nombre d'employés dans son administration publique pour faire face aux défis économiques actuels.
articles.original_article_title: Vietnam: cure d’austérité sans précédent dans l'administration du pays

Vietnam.explanation: A socialist republic in Southeast Asia, bordered by China, Laos, and Cambodia
Vietnam.cultural_note: Former French colony that gained independence in 1954, unified under communist rule in 1976

:.explanation: Used to introduce an explanation or list

cure.explanation: In this context, refers to a corrective measure or treatment program
cure.cultural_note: Often used in French media to describe economic or administrative reforms

d'.explanation: Preposition indicating possession or characteristic, shortened before vowel sounds

austérité.explanation: Economic policy of reduced spending and increased frugality
austérité.cultural_note: Term gained prominence during European economic crisis of 2008-2015

sans.explanation: Preposition indicating the absence of something

précédent.explanation: Refers to something that has never happened before in history

l'.explanation: Definite article, shortened before vowel sounds

administration.explanation: The governmental organization and its employees that manage public affairs
administration.cultural_note: In France and Vietnam, 'administration' often refers to public sector bureaucracy

articles.title: Nouvelle loi pour contrôler les prix des loyers
articles.english_title: New Law to Control Rental Prices
articles.simplified_french_title: Nouvelle loi pour contrôler les prix des loyers
articles.simplified_english_title: New Law to Control Rental Prices
articles.summary: Des députés de gauche proposent une nouvelle loi pour continuer à limiter les prix des loyers dans certaines villes françaises.
articles.english_summary: Left-wing lawmakers have proposed new legislation to continue controlling rental prices in certain French cities.
articles.french_summary: Des députés de gauche proposent une nouvelle loi pour continuer à limiter les prix des loyers dans certaines villes françaises.
articles.original_article_title: Logement : une proposition de loi pour pérenniser l’encadrement des loyers

Logement.explanation: Refers to residential properties or places where people live. Can be used for both houses and apartments.
Logement.cultural_note: Housing is a major political issue in France, especially in large cities where affordability is a growing concern.

:.explanation: Used to introduce an explanation or list. In French headlines, frequently used to separate the topic from the specific news.

une.explanation: Used before feminine nouns to indicate an unspecified item or concept.

proposition.display_format: **Proposal/Bill:** A formal suggestion or draft law
proposition.explanation: In legislative context, refers to a bill or proposed law before it becomes enacted.
proposition.cultural_note: In French politics, 'proposition de loi' comes from parliament members, while 'projet de loi' comes from the government.

de.explanation: Used to show possession, origin, or relationship between words.

loi.explanation: A rule or regulation enacted by a governing body.
loi.cultural_note: The French legislative system distinguishes between different types of laws and their origins.

pérenniser.explanation: To make something lasting or permanent, to ensure long-term continuation.

l'.explanation: Used before words starting with vowels or silent h, replacing 'la' or 'le'.

encadrement.explanation: The act of setting limits or regulations around something.
encadrement.cultural_note: A common concept in French governance, where state regulation of prices is more accepted than in some other countries.

des.explanation: Used before plural nouns, combining 'de' and 'les'.

loyers.explanation: The amount paid by tenants to landlords for use of property.
loyers.cultural_note: Rent control is a significant political issue in France, particularly in large cities like Paris where housing costs are high.

articles.title: Le recensement en Guinée continue, mais s'arrête pour les Guinéens en France
articles.english_title: Census in Guinea continues but stops for Guineans in France
articles.simplified_french_title: Le recensement en Guinée continue, mais s'arrête pour les Guinéens en France
articles.simplified_english_title: Census in Guinea continues but stops for Guineans in France
articles.summary: La Guinée prolonge son recensement jusqu'au 20 juin. En France, le processus est arrêté à cause de problèmes dans les centres d'inscription.
articles.english_summary: Guinea extends its census until June 20. In France, the process has been halted due to problems at registration centers.
articles.french_summary: La Guinée prolonge son recensement jusqu'au 20 juin. En France, le processus est arrêté à cause de problèmes dans les centres d'inscription.
articles.original_article_title: Le recensement prolongé en Guinée mais suspendu pour les expatriés en France

Le.explanation: Used before masculine singular nouns to indicate something specific

recensement.explanation: A systematic counting and recording of a population, typically including various demographic details
recensement.cultural_note: In many African countries, census operations are crucial for electoral processes and often politically sensitive

prolongé.explanation: Past participle of 'prolonger', meaning to extend or lengthen the duration of something

en.explanation: Used to indicate location or position within a place

Guinée.explanation: A country in West Africa, formerly a French colony
Guinée.cultural_note: Gained independence from France in 1958 and maintains strong ties with France

mais.explanation: Used to introduce a contrasting idea or statement

suspendu.explanation: Past participle of 'suspendre', meaning to temporarily halt or interrupt an activity

pour.explanation: Used to indicate who or what is affected by an action

les.explanation: Used before plural nouns to indicate specific items or people

expatriés.display_format: **Expatriates:** People living outside their native country
expatriés.explanation: Refers to people who have left their country to live or work in another country
expatriés.cultural_note: France has significant African expatriate communities, particularly from former colonies

en France.explanation: Indicates location within the country of France
en France.cultural_note: France maintains strong connections with its former African colonies through expatriate communities

articles.title: Le nouveau plan du gouvernement pour améliorer la santé mentale
articles.english_title: Government's New Mental Health Plan: Better Training and Faster Care
articles.simplified_french_title: Le nouveau plan du gouvernement pour améliorer la santé mentale
articles.simplified_english_title: Government's New Mental Health Plan: Better Training and Faster Care
articles.summary: Le gouvernement présente un plan pour mieux aider les jeunes qui ont des problèmes de santé mentale, avec formation spéciale pour le personnel médical.
articles.english_summary: The government presents a plan to better help young people with mental health issues, including special training for medical staff.
articles.french_summary: Le gouvernement présente un plan pour mieux aider les jeunes qui ont des problèmes de santé mentale, avec formation spéciale pour le personnel médical.
articles.original_article_title: Renforcement des formations, prise en charge plus rapide... Ce que contient le plan pour la santé mentale présenté par le gouvernement

Renforcement.display_format: **Strengthening/Reinforcement:** Making something stronger or more effective
Renforcement.explanation: From the verb 'renforcer', meaning to strengthen or enhance. In this context, it refers to improving or intensifying training programs.

des.explanation: Contraction of 'de les', used before plural nouns to indicate possession or relationship

formations.display_format: **Training programs:** Educational or professional development courses
formations.explanation: Refers to structured educational programs designed to develop specific skills or knowledge
formations.cultural_note: In France, 'formation' has a broader meaning than just training, encompassing education and professional development

prise en charge.explanation: Literally 'taking into charge', refers to the process of providing care or treatment to patients
prise en charge.cultural_note: Common term in French healthcare system, implying both medical care and administrative handling

plus.explanation: Used to form comparatives, indicating an increase or higher degree of something

rapide.explanation: Describes something that happens or is done quickly or efficiently

Ce que.explanation: Used to introduce a clause explaining or describing something

contient.explanation: From 'contenir', meaning to have within or include something

plan.explanation: A detailed proposal for doing or achieving something
plan.cultural_note: In French politics, 'plan' often refers to major government initiatives or strategies

santé mentale.explanation: Refers to emotional, psychological, and social well-being
santé mentale.cultural_note: Mental health has become an increasingly important focus in French healthcare policy, especially post-COVID

présenté.explanation: Past participle of 'présenter', meaning to show or introduce something formally

par.explanation: Indicates the agent or doer of an action

le gouvernement.explanation: Refers to the executive branch of the French state
le gouvernement.cultural_note: In France, 'le gouvernement' specifically refers to the executive branch led by the Prime Minister under the President

articles.title: La fin des limites pour les étudiants en médecine permettra de former plus de médecins
articles.english_title: End of Medical School Enrollment Limits Will Allow Training More Doctors
articles.simplified_french_title: La fin des limites pour les étudiants en médecine permettra de former plus de médecins
articles.simplified_english_title: End of Medical School Enrollment Limits Will Allow Training More Doctors
articles.summary: Le ministre de la Santé annonce la suppression des limites d'admission en médecine et veut rendre la psychiatrie plus attractive pour les étudiants.
articles.english_summary: The Health Minister announces the removal of medical school admission limits and aims to make psychiatry more attractive to students.
articles.french_summary: Le ministre de la Santé annonce la suppression des limites d'admission en médecine et veut rendre la psychiatrie plus attractive pour les étudiants.
articles.original_article_title: Fin du numerus apertus: "C'est une première mesure pour pouvoir permettre la formation de plus de médecins", estime Bastien Bailleul, président du syndicat des internes en médecine générale

Fin.explanation: Indicates the termination or ending of something

du.explanation: A contracted form combining the preposition 'de' (of) with the definite article 'le' (the)

numerus apertus.explanation: A Latin term used in French education system referring to flexible admission quotas in medical schools
numerus apertus.cultural_note: Replaced the stricter numerus clausus system in 2020 but still maintained certain limitations on medical student numbers

une.explanation: Feminine indefinite article used before nouns

première.explanation: Indicates something that comes first in a sequence or is most important

mesure.explanation: Refers to a policy decision or action implemented to achieve a goal

permettre.explanation: To make something possible or give permission

la formation.explanation: Refers to the educational process or professional preparation

de plus de.explanation: Phrase indicating an increase in quantity

médecins.cultural_note: France has been facing a shortage of doctors, particularly in rural areas

estime.explanation: To express an opinion or make an assessment

Bastien Bailleul.cultural_note: A prominent figure in French medical education

président.explanation: The person in charge of an organization

du syndicat.explanation: Refers to a professional association or union
du syndicat.cultural_note: Labor unions and professional associations play important roles in French society

des internes.explanation: Refers to doctors in their residency training period
des internes.cultural_note: Medical residency in France is called 'internat'

en médecine générale.explanation: Refers to primary care or family medicine practice
en médecine générale.cultural_note: General practitioners are called 'médecins généralistes' in France

articles.title: Le Sénat devient plus important au Parlement
articles.english_title: The Senate Becomes the Key Player in Parliament
articles.simplified_french_title: Le Sénat devient plus important au Parlement
articles.simplified_english_title: The Senate Becomes the Key Player in Parliament
articles.summary: Sans majorité à l'Assemblée nationale, le Sénat est devenu plus stable et plus influent dans la politique française depuis 2022.
articles.english_summary: With no majority in the National Assembly, the Senate has become more stable and influential in French politics since 2022.
articles.french_summary: Sans majorité à l'Assemblée nationale, le Sénat est devenu plus stable et plus influent dans la politique française depuis 2022.
articles.original_article_title: Un Sénat devenu maître du jeu parlementaire

Un.explanation: Indefinite article used before masculine singular nouns

Sénat.explanation: The upper chamber of the French Parliament, consisting of 348 senators elected indirectly by regional and local officials
Sénat.cultural_note: Unlike the National Assembly, the Senate tends to be more conservative and has been dominated by the right-wing since the establishment of the Fifth Republic in 1958

devenu.explanation: Indicates a change of state or condition, used with être in compound tenses

maître.explanation: Refers to someone or something that has control or authority over a situation
maître.cultural_note: The term carries connotations of authority and expertise in French culture

du.explanation: Contracted form combining the preposition 'de' (of) with the definite article 'le' (the)

jeu.explanation: In this context, refers to political maneuvering or dynamics
jeu.cultural_note: Often used metaphorically in French politics to describe power dynamics

parlementaire.explanation: Refers to activities, processes, or matters related to the parliament
parlementaire.cultural_note: The French parliamentary system is bicameral, consisting of the National Assembly and the Senate
